title: Watch 'Voice' Singer Stephanie Rice's Inspiring Kelly Clarkson Cover - Rolling Stone
text:
Watch 'Voice' Singer Stephanie Rice's Inspiring Kelly Clarkson Cover Rice brought Clarkson to tears singing "Piece By Piece," being disowned by family at age 18 Stephanie Rice's performed Kelly Clarkson's "Piece by Piece" on 'The Voice' on Monday with enough emotion to make Clarkson cry. All Stories 
The Voice contestant Stephanie Rice gave a stirring rendition of Kelly Clarkson 's "Piece By Piece" on Monday, coupled with a harrowing story of how her parents disowned her for coming out at age 18. Clarkson responded to the performance on Twitter: "Can't. Stop. Crying." Related Watch Kelly Clarkson Perform Somber 'Hamilton' Ballad on 'The Voice' Season 11 runner-up Billy Gilman joined singer for "It's Quiet Uptown" during finale episode, backed by string quartet 
Like Clarkson, Rice (age 27) is from Texas and grew up in a religious household. "They disowned me," said Rice when she came out as gay. "I've been taking the brokenness and emotion and channeling that into the only form I know â€¦ which is music." 
Clarkson co-wrote "Piece by Piece" with Greg Kurstin, the ballad-expert who also worked on Adele's "Hello." The single became a Top Ten hit for Clarkson. Rice's rendition was more Joplin-esque in its delivery: growling and gliding dynamically through the song. 
Clarkson wasn't the only star enthralled by Rice's performance. Voice judge Blake Shelton turned around before Rice made it to the 20-second mark. Gwen Stefani did the same within 10 seconds (Rice chose to be on Stefani's team). Alicia Keys also listened intensely, audibly marveling at Rice's voice. Can't. Stop.
